abstract.description:
Condition database includes non-event-related information (Alignment, Calibration, Temperature, etc.) and parameters for simulation/reconstruction/analysis software.

These files are needed when running a CMSSW job on the open data environment (VM or container), and they are available in the /cvmfs/cms-opendata-conddb.cern.ch file system. They are automatically read from /cvmfs/cms-opendata-conddb.cern.ch/76X_dataRun2_16Dec2015_v0.db runtime.

76X_dataRun2_16Dec2015_v0 is for the full event range of both for RunC and RunD 2015 collision data.

See further information in the guide to CMS condition database.

For condition data to be used with 2015 CMS simulated datasets see:

title: Condition data for 2015 CMS collision data

abstract.description:
Condition database includes non-event-related information (Alignment, Calibration, Temperature, etc.) and parameters for simulation/reconstruction/analysis software.

These files are needed when running a CMSSW job on the open data environment (VM or container), and they are available in the /cvmfs/cms-opendata-conddb.cern.ch file system. They are automatically read from /cvmfs/cms-opendata-conddb.cern.ch/76X_mcRun2_asymptotic_RunIIFall15DR76_v1.db runtime.

76X_mcRun2_asymptotic_RunIIFall15DR76_v1 is to be used with the simulated data.

See further information in the guide to CMS condition database.

For condition data to be used with 2015 CMS collision data see:

title: Condition data for 2015 CMS simulated datasets
